Package fr.utt.lo02.tdvp.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
fr.utt.lo02.tdvp.controller.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
Main game controller in the MVC architecture. It makes a link between the views and the models. This class uses the singleton design pattern.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Controller getInstance()
      Returns the unique instance of the class.
      Returns:
      The unique instance of the class

    • setVariant

      public void setVariant​(int answer)
      Sets the game variant.
      Parameters:
      answer - The user answer. Should be 1 (random switch) or 2 (second chance). Otherwise it will be ignored.

    • setLayoutShape

      public void setLayoutShape​(int answer)
      Sets the game board layout.
      Parameters:
      answer - The user answer. Should be 1 (rectangle) or 2 (circle).

    • setPhysicalPlayersNumber

      public void setPhysicalPlayersNumber​(int answer)
      Sets the number of physical players.
      Parameters:
      answer - The user answer. Should be in the range [1-3].

    • setPlayerName

      public void setPlayerName​(int playerIndex, java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of a player.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - The index of the player
      name - The name of the player

    • setVirtualPlayer

      public void setVirtualPlayer​(int count)
      Sets the number of virtual players.
      Parameters:
      count - The number of virtual players. count + physicalPlayersCount should be in range [2 ; 3]

    • placeCard

      public boolean placeCard​(int x, int y, Card card)
      Places the card to a specified location.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate of the location
      y - The y coordinate of the location
      card - The card to place at this location
      Returns:
      true if the card has been placed, false if it cannot be placed here

    • moveCards

      public boolean moveCards​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Moves a card at a specified location.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x coordinate of the originate location
      y1 - The y coordinate of the originate location
      x2 - The x coordinate of the destination location
      y2 - The y coordinate of the destination location
      Returns:
      true if the card has been placed, false if it cannot be placed here
